newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria unemployment edges up to 10.5 pct in Sept.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria unemployment edges up to 10.5 pct in Sept.

text.p: The number of people unemployed in Bulgaria rose to 401,634 or 10.5 percent of the workforce, in September from 396,155 the month before, the National Labour Exchange (NLE) said.

"The rise was mainly due to the inflow of people from non-industrial sectors to the labour market as some 2,800 teachers lost their jobs in September," Milcho Dimitrov, deputy social care minister and NLE chairman, told Reuters.
Dimitrov said closures of state firms slated for liquidation by the government did not have a considerable impact on unemployment last month due to the slow pace of liquidation.

"However, the closures are expected to boost unemployment in October by 5,000 to 8,000 people following government pledges to international lenders to speed up liquidation of debt-ridden firms," Dimitrov said.

Last month the International Monetary Fund again postponed a second $115 million tranche of funding to Bulgaria until the Socialist cabinet completes closures of 64 state loss-makers under a funding agreement sealed in July. -- Sofia Newsroom, 359-2-84561
